bibl.title: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to Jefferson Randolph Kean, May 30, 1927

div1.p: Kelly thanks Kean for a memo about Noguchi, a reference to another memo, and his remarks about the yellow fever episode. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to Jefferson Randolph Kean, May 30, 1927
div1.opener:
HOWARD A. KELLY, M. D.
LIBRARY
1406 EUTAW PLACE, BALTIMORE, MD.
CABLE ADDRESS, “HAKELLY,” BALTIMORE
May 30, 1927.
Dear Colonel Keen:
div1.p:
Thank you for your reference to
a memo of Porter's. I shall look it up.

I note your remarks about the
yellow fever episode. Our friend here is a
good deal of an enthusiast, but his judgment is not
always to be depended upon.

Thank you for the memorandum
about Noguchi. I am too sorry, as it seemed to
offer so much hope. I will make the correction
the first opportunity I have.
div1.closer:
Faithfully yours, Howard A Kelly Assoc'n Military Surgeons, U.S.
JUN 1 1927
Secretary-Treasurer's Office.
Eminent Gynecologist one of
the four Doctors of Sargent's celebrated painting
